comments.author: daniel@glazman.org
comments.text:
CSS Animations and Transitions should be disabled (ie they should not run)
in the editor. If I take one of the examples from MDN [1], a H1 is moving
and is editable ! But for some infinite-loop animations, it will be hell.

[1] https://developer.mozilla.org/samples/cssref/animations/cssanim1.html

This should be disabled from nsHTMLEditor::nsHTMLEditor using a new API on
the docshell, just like we disable JS and plugins and animated images IIRC.

Neil mentioned on IRC the Preview Mode of Seamonkey Composer. The Preview mode
is the regular HTML editor but without specific editing stylesheets. It does
not make sense any more ; given how dynamic Web pages have become, a Preview
must enable JS, plugins, animations and transitions. The Preview mode must
then become a <browser> instead of an <editor> or rely on external preview.
So no need to care about that in this patch, IMHO.
comments.creator: daniel@glazman.org

comments.author: daniel@glazman.org
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #2)

> What if an author wants an animation in something that's contentEditable?

Then they take the risk of having content theoritically editable and
practically impossible to edit because it's animated... That's why we
originally decided to disable all things dynamic in that case.
